description: All gift certificates come with a free cat. Seriously, though, the perfect gift. No shipping, no handling, and we'll store the name of the recipient in our database in case it's ever lost.

name: Write of Summer 2013
description:
Write of Summer -- a camp for kids in Charleston since 2003! Monday through Friday, 9 am to noon. $165 Locations: Blue Bicycle Books, downtown Charleston Christ Our King Church, Mt. Pleasant Hibben United Methodist Church, Mt. Pleasant Circular Church, downtown Charleston session 1 june 10 – 14, grades 3 – 6, BBB SESSION FULL
session 2 june 17 – 21, grades 7 – 9, BBB
session 3 july 15 – 19, grades 7 – 12, COK SESSION FULL
session 4 july 22 – 26, grades 3 – 6 AND 7 - 12, HIBB
session 5 july 29 - aug. 2, grades 7 - 12, BBB SESSION FULL
session 6 aug. 5 - 9, grades 3 - 6, BBB
session 7 aug. 12 - 16, grades 3 - 6, CCC SESSION FULL
Please do send in a hardcopy registration form even if you pay online. Forms and more information are available at writeofsummer.com If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to call or write -- 843.722.2666 or jonathansanchez@aya.yale.edu.

name: Charleston Impressions by Jane Iseley and William P. Baldwin
description:
Charleston Impressions

Jane Iseley and William P. Baldwin

With photographs by renowned photography Jane Iseley and text by historian William P. Baldwin. A photographic tour of Charleston's architecture and history, perfect for your coffee table. NEW - Legacy Publications, hb., 112 pp

name:
The War Below
James Scott SIGNED
description:
The War Below

James Scott

From acclaimed author and historian James Scott, The War Below is a fascinating history of World War II in the Pacific. Focusing on the story of three American submarines, Scott describes the heroic attacks and strategy that helped win the war by ravaging Japan’s merchant fleet and destroying the nation’s economy. Also available is Scott's previous title The Attack on the Liberty . This shocking attack proved to be the most deadly assault on an American ship since the Japanese torpedoed the U.S.S. Indianapolis in the waning days of World War II. James' father was on this ship, and the book recounts the story of the attack and the impact it had on the lives of the crew. Release date May 15

name:
McElligot's Pool
Dr. Seuss
description:
McElligot's Pool

Dr. Suess

New York: Random House, 1947. Quarto, original light blue-green boards, pictorial endpapers, original dust jacket. Edition is "Variant 3" with 7 line copyright notice.

name: YALLFest Contribution
description: YALLFest Contribution Varying Levels Supporting YALLFest means aligning yourself with a rich cultural and literary community, and a powerful cause. Our mission is to improve literacy through great Young Adult literature. Your contribution brings renowned and inspiring authors to an under-served group, including underprivileged and minority teen readers in the South. The YALLFest audience is a devoted and passionate group of kids who take books and their authors to heart. On behalf of the YALLFest board, volunteers, and especially the thousands of fans, THANK YOU for your generous contribution. YALLFest is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. All contributions are tax deductible. Click on the drop-down menu below to pay online. Checks can be made payable to YALLFest Charleston and mailed to YALLFest c/o Blue Bicycle Books 420 King St. Charleston, SC 29403 For more information please contact Jonathan Sanchez, 843.722.2666 or jonathan@bluebicyclebooks.com. yallfest.org

name: Bandit by Jonathan Sanchez
description:
Blue Bicycle Books owner Jonathan Sanchez is the author of these nine stories featuring a crane operator, a Wild Wing waitress, two massage therapists, a moonshine runner, the great white hope of the elite middle-distance circuit, and a pair of socks. All are participants, willing or not, one way or the other, in the Cooper River Bridge Run.

SIGNED. 

If you would like this copy inscribed, please include a name in your note, or call or write us at 843.722.2666 or jonathan@bluebicyclebooks.com

name: Gone With the Wind by Margaret Mitchell - SIGNED
description:
Gone With the Wind

by Margaret Mitchell

SIGNED Macmillan, 1936 - First edition, first printing. Signed in black ink by Mitchell on the front free endpaper, as was her custom. With all first printing, first issue indicators: “Published May, 1936” on copyright page, rear panel has GWTW listed second in the right-hand column. Price-clipped dust jacket is in protective mylar cover, has some small wear on the top and bottom edges and some wear at the corner and fold stress points, otherwise is in near fine condition. Grey cloth-covered boards, binding and pages are essentially as new. Comes in a custom grey slipcase with 1936 Macmillan booklet. Overall, the finest copy we have ever seen of this book -- hard to imagine a richer, more meaningful collector's item, one that will only continue to grow in significance and value. "It is the song of the fallen, unregenerate Troy, the one sung in a lower key by the women who had to pick up the pieces of a fractured society when their sons and husbands returned with their cause in their throats." -- Pat Conroy $19,900 Presented for sale by Blue Bicycle Books, selling used, rare and local-interest books on King Street in historic downtown Charleston since 1995. Please feel free to call us with any questions. 843.722.2666.

name: Dorothea Benton Frank Author Luncheon and Signed Book
description: Dorothea Benton Frank Author Luncheon, with Signed Copy of The Last Original Wife Fri., Jun. 14, 11:30 am, at the Charleston Marriott, 170 Lockwood Blvd. Join us as we continue our author luncheon series with best-selling author and Sullivan's Island homegirl Dorothea Benton Frank. Tickets are $60 and include lunch, author talk, and a signed copy of Frank's new novel The Last Original Wife (Harper Collins, 368 pp., hb., $26.99. Release Date: June 11, 2013). Free Parking Dottie is extra excited for this, the major event of her tour, so don't miss this chance to meet her and have a great time in beautiful downtown Charleston!

name:
Rural Carolinian
Edited by D.H. Jacques
description:
The Rural Carolinian: An Illustrated Magazine of Agriculture, Horticulture and the Arts, Vol. V

Edited by D.H. Jacques

"Progress with Prudence, Practice with Science" Bound in quarter leather with marbled boards, Vol. 5 of the Rural Carolinian is 11 issues of this Charleston magazine, from Oct. 1873 to Aug. 1874. Binding is still tight. A wonderful copy. The occasional loose issue of the Rural Carolinian is available, but we have never seen a bound volume. Topics include: Boys, The Right Kind; Bee-Stings, Remedies for; Bed-bug Preventive; Immigants for South Carolina; Guano Deposits, New; What Can be Done in North Carolina; Study of Faces; Fried Chicken, and hundreds more. Printed by Walker, Evans & Cogswell, 3 Broad St. and 109 E. Bay St., Charleston. 1874, 672 pp.

name:
The Autumn of the Patriarch
Gabriel García Márquez
description:
The Autumn of the Patriarch

Gabriel García Márquez

First edition, first printing. (The incomplete number line to 5 is a well-documented publisher’s error.) Original price of $10.00 intact, jacket has some small tears and scuffs but is vibrant and protected in mylar cover. Considered by some to be his masterpiece (no small claim) Autumn shows the influence of William Faulkner on his fellow (would-be) Nobel Laureate. The 269 pages are in six chapters, each of which is a single paragraph, and each paragraph is only a handful of sentences. Like several other Garcia Marquez novels, the theme of old age is prevalent, but most of all, this is a colorful, intense depiction of the lonely life of a dictator, a loneliness any reader can identify with. Harper & Rowe,1976, hb., 269

name:

Gary Smith
SIGNED
description:
Going Deep: 20 Classic Sports Stories

Gary Smith
SIGNED

Long-time Sports Illustrated writer and Charleston resident Gary Smith handpicked his favorite articles from his last 25 years of sports journalism for Going Deep. From the famous to the obscure, Smith explores athletic passion, talent, and motivation. Four of the included stories have won National Magazine Awards, the most won by any single writer. Smith's work has also been featured in Best American Sports Writing as well as inspired the movie Radio.

description:
The Great Santini

Pat Conroy
Conroy's autobiographical first novel is the story of the Meecham family and their abusive marine fighter pilot father. Later made into a film starring Robert Duvall. Pat is currently at work on a sequel which will focus on his father's late-in-life redemption. Will ship after Nov. 23. New - Old New York Book Shop Press, 2004 (reprint), hb., 536 pp.

name:
Pompeiana, 3 vol. set
Sir William Gell and J.P.Gandy
description:
Pompeiana; the Topography, Edifices and, Ornaments of Pompeii

Sir William Gell and J.P.Gandy

Two works in three volumes. Volume I is the rare 1819 first edition by Gell and Gandy. 77 numbered and 5 unnumbered plates, many folding and double-pages. Thomas Jefferson owned a copy of this edition. Compiled over a three year period, Gell’s illustrations of the ruins were made with a camera obscura and are noted for their accuracy. Later editions contain fewer plates. Volumes II and III are an 1837 reissue of the 1830-32 work by Gell alone, “the result of excavations since 1819.” All volumes have been uniformly rebound in quarter-calf with marbled boards. Volume one alone catalogs for $2750. Our price, three-volume set, $1995.

The book includes Simmons's personal recollections from over seventy years of perfecting his craft, as well as a map of downtown Charleston detailing the location and description of each creation by Simmons. name:
Southern Biscuits
Nathalie Dupree and Cynthia Graubart
SIGNED
description:
Southern Biscuits

Nathalie Dupree and Cynthia Graubart
SIGNED by Nathalie Dupree

Nathalie Dupree is a James Beard-award-winning chef and food writer, and the author of Nathalie Dupree’s Shrimp and Grits, New Southern Cooking and many others. Layered, fluffy, feathery, silky, soft, and velvety biscuits all come together in Southern Biscuits, a book of recipes and baking secrets. New - Gibbs Smith, 2011, hb., 216 pp.

name:

description:
Blue Roots: African-American Folk magic of the Gullah People

Roger Pinckney

name: YALLFest Exhibitor Fee
description:
YALLFest 2013 will feature a full day of stimulating talks by award-winning writers, signings, and a bustling Literary Marketplace. 

Authors, publishers, companies with book-related products, and other businesses interested in becoming a YALLFest 2013 Exhibitor should submit an application (see www.yallfest.org/exhibitors) as well as the fee below.

Thank you for joining us -- we think you'll love it!

Please contact Jonathan Sanchez at 843.722.2666 or jonathan@bluebicyclebooks.com with any questions.
